name: places/ChIJCdgDauVZwokRv3gWy6uLdAc
formattedAddress: 20 Union Square W, New York, NY 10003, USA
adrFormatAddress: 20 Union Square W, New York, NY 10003, USA

originalText.text: The best parts of this place are certainly the building and it’s interior. It’s such a cool building and it’s expertly decorated as well. It almost feels like you’re in Florida or somewhere tropical, when really you’re just in Union Square. The service was really friendly and helpful with the questions we had, and the flavors were unique and tasty! I had the snap pea Caesar salad which was decent, but I did really like how they added mint to that dish to make it pop. I also had the sausage and cheese pizzas, both of which I thought were good. I liked the cheese pizza better than the sausage because it had a lighter taste, but I did like both of them. Overall a really neat little spot in the heart of Union Square! Oh, I forgot to mention that it closes in late October so make sure you get a visit in ASAP.

originalText.text: Went for dinner and had a great time. Great vibes, especially with the semi-outdoor setting.  The food was a mix of innovative and classic - and so delicious. Loved the fresh summer cocktails as well. Friendly, attentive staff. Union Square needed a place like this!

text.text: Went for dinner and had a great time. Great vibes, especially with the semi-outdoor setting.  The food was a mix of innovative and classic - and so delicious. Loved the fresh summer cocktails as well. Friendly, attentive staff. Union Square needed a place like this!

originalText.text: In a beautiful location with great views and vibes. Management actually took care of our check when the wind picked up and knocked over a large vase behind my girlfriend. I got the sense that everyone who worked there was really considerate of customer service. Our waitress was phenomenal even before the "vase incident". And the meatball sub & pizza we ordered were great as well!

And the meatball sub & pizza we ordered were great as well!

originalText.text: Loved my dinner sitting at the counter overlooking the park. It felt like an extremely classy picnic, ideal for people watching. The starters were excellent but the pizza was the real standout- crispy crust, excellent tomato sauce. Can’t wait to return!

text.text: Loved my dinner sitting at the counter overlooking the park. It felt like an extremely classy picnic, ideal for people watching. The starters were excellent but the pizza was the real standout- crispy crust, excellent tomato sauce. Can’t wait to return!

originalText.text: Incredible pizza and shareable plates at a cool open-air space that’s perfect for summer. We had super fast and attentive service even with a big group and were able to try basically everything on the menu. Bocce bread is a revelation and the cocktails and frozen negronis are legit. Definitely worth a visit
